_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Secondary Smelting and Alloying of Aluminum

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source

Aleris has implemented a Risk Management Program in accordance with the requirements of the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions. In the event of an emergency, ALERIS has

coordinated emergency response efforts with the Coldwater Fire Department and the City of Coldwater's Local

Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

ALERIS manufactures aluminum sows and molten aluminum in crucibles from various types of recycled aluminum scrap. At the time of this submittal, ALERIS is subject to the requirements under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions since the facility maintains chlorine on-site in a quantity greater than the 2,500 pounds threshold. Chlorine is used at the facility to remove impurities from the recycled aluminum.





General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

To meet the requirements of the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions, ALERIS has implemented  the RMP Prevention Program 3 requirements.



Emergency Response Program

ALERIS has developed an emergency response plan in accordance with the requirements of the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions. Additionally, ALERIS has coordinated emergency response with both the Coldwater Fire Department and the City of Coldwater's LEPC. In the event of an emergency, ALERIS will follow the procedures outlined in the emergency response plan.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

ALERIS is currently evaluating and processing recommendations from the recent process hazard analysis performed for the chlorine operation.



Five Year Accident History 

There have not been any accidents involving chlorine at the facility.
